definitions: unusually large in size or extent compared to what is normal or expected
examples: The company faces outsized challenges in the global market
His outsized personality filled every room he entered

definitions: expressing opinions freely and directly without fear of consequences or criticism
examples: She was outspoken about workplace discrimination issues
The outspoken critic challenged every government policy

definitions: stretched out to full length or extent, especially referring to arms or limbs
examples: She greeted him with outstretched arms for a hug
The bird soared overhead with outstretched wings

definitions: moving or directed away from a center or interior point
relating to external appearance or behavior rather than inner feelings
examples: The outward flow of traffic increased during rush hour
His outward journey took him across three continents
Her outward calm concealed deep anxiety within
The outward signs of illness were becoming apparent

definitions: having a rounded and elongated shape like an egg or ellipse
examples: The oval mirror complemented the room's classic decor
They arranged the chairs in an oval pattern

definitions: relating to or affecting the ovaries, which are female reproductive organs
examples: The doctor diagnosed her with ovarian cysts
Ovarian cancer screening is recommended for high-risk women

definitions: more active than normal or desirable, often causing problems or discomfort
examples: His overactive imagination kept him awake at night
The child's overactive thyroid required medical treatment

definitions: unpleasantly dominating in manner, trying to control others through force or intimidation
examples: Her overbearing mother insisted on planning the entire wedding
The overbearing manager made employees dread coming to work

definitions: made to seem more important or impressive than reality warrants through exaggeration
examples: The media coverage of the scandal was completely overblown
His overblown ego made collaboration nearly impossible

definitions: covered with clouds that block direct sunlight, creating a gray appearance
examples: The overcast sky threatened rain throughout the afternoon
Photography can be challenging on overcast days

definitions: having too much confidence in one's abilities, often leading to mistakes or failure
examples: The overconfident student didn't study and failed the exam
His overconfident predictions about the market proved costly

definitions: carried to excess or exaggerated beyond what is appropriate or tasteful
cooked for too long, resulting in dryness or toughness
examples: The actor's overdone performance distracted from the story
Her makeup was overdone for such a casual event
The overdone steak was tough and difficult to chew
These overdone vegetables have lost all their nutrients

definitions: not completed, paid, or returned by the required or expected time
examples: The library book is three weeks overdue
Her baby was overdue by ten days

definitions: flowing over the brim or edges of a container
present in such large amounts as to seem uncontainable
examples: The overflowing bathtub flooded the bathroom floor
Rain caused the overflowing river to breach its banks
Her heart was overflowing with gratitude and joy
The overflowing crowd spilled out into the street

definitions: having grown beyond normal or desired size, especially plants growing wild
examples: The overgrown garden needed immediate attention and pruning
An overgrown path led to the abandoned house

definitions: positioned directly above or in the sky or ceiling area
examples: The overhead lights cast shadows across the room
Birds flew overhead in perfect formation

definitions: heated to an excessive degree, causing discomfort or mechanical problems
examples: The overheated engine started smoking on the highway
The overheated room made everyone feel drowsy

definitions: filled with extreme happiness or delight beyond ordinary joy
examples: She was overjoyed when she received the acceptance letter
The overjoyed parents welcomed their first grandchild

definitions: traveling or extending across land rather than by sea or air
examples: They chose an overland route through Central Asia
The overland journey took three months to complete

definitions: loaded with too much weight, work, or information beyond safe capacity
examples: The overloaded truck struggled up the steep hill
Her overloaded schedule left no time for rest

definitions: failed to notice or consider something that should have received attention
examples: The overlooked detail proved crucial to solving the case
She felt overlooked for promotion despite excellent performance

definitions: having a view from a higher position looking down on something
examples: The restaurant overlooking the harbor offered stunning views
A balcony overlooking the garden provided peaceful mornings

definitions: happening, staying, or lasting through the night
happening very quickly or suddenly without warning
examples: The overnight rain left puddles everywhere
She packed for an overnight trip to Boston
He became an overnight success after the video went viral
The company's overnight transformation surprised industry experts

definitions: so strong or intense as to be difficult to resist or endure
examples: The overpowering smell of perfume filled the elevator
His overpowering personality dominated every conversation

definitions: priced higher than the actual value or what people consider reasonable
examples: The overpriced restaurant disappointed with mediocre food
These overpriced apartments are driving residents away

definitions: protecting someone, especially a child, more than necessary, potentially limiting their independence
examples: His overprotective parents wouldn't let him play outside
The overprotective dog growled at every visitor

definitions: more important than any other consideration, taking precedence over everything else
examples: Safety was their overriding concern during construction
The overriding goal was to protect civilian lives

definitions: situated, originating, or happening in countries across the ocean
examples: The company expanded its overseas operations to Asia
Many students pursue overseas education opportunities

definitions: bigger than the standard or usual size for something
examples: The oversize shirt hung loosely on her frame
They ordered an oversize pizza for the party

definitions: made or being larger than normal or standard size
examples: She wore oversized sunglasses to hide her face
The oversized furniture overwhelmed the small room

definitions: expressed or stated too strongly, making something seem more significant than reality
examples: The report's conclusions were greatly overstated
His overstated claims undermined his credibility

definitions: done or shown openly and plainly without attempt at concealment
examples: There was no overt hostility between the two groups
His overt displays of wealth attracted unwanted attention

definitions: physically turned over so the top becomes the bottom
reversed or cancelled, especially referring to legal decisions
examples: The overturned car blocked both lanes of traffic
Strong winds left overturned tables throughout the park
The court overturned the previous ruling on appeal
The overturned policy had been in place for decades

definitions: weighing more than is considered healthy or normal for one's height
examples: The doctor advised the overweight patient to exercise more
Airlines charge extra fees for overweight luggage

definitions: in a state of extreme emotional agitation, nervous excitement, or anxiety
examples: The overwrought mother couldn't stop crying at graduation
His overwrought reaction to criticism surprised everyone

definitions: showing too much energy or enthusiasm in pursuit of a cause or objective
examples: The overzealous security guard upset many innocent shoppers
Her overzealous cleaning damaged the antique furniture

definitions: remaining unpaid or unsettled as a debt or obligation
examples: The rent owing from last month must be paid immediately
There are still wages owing to former employees

definitions: belonging to or possessed by a particular person or entity
examples: The family owned business celebrated its fiftieth anniversary
All owned vehicles must display parking permits

definitions: having undergone a chemical reaction with oxygen, often resulting in rust or discoloration
examples: The oxidized copper roof had turned green over time
Oxidized silver jewelry needs special cleaning

definitions: peaceful in character or intent, tending to promote peace
examples: His pacific manner helped calm the angry crowd
The pacific settlement avoided years of litigation

definitions: believing in or advocating for the principle that disputes should be settled without violence
examples: The pacifist movement organized peaceful protests against war
Her pacifist beliefs prevented her from military service

definitions: put into a container or wrapping for storage, transport, or sale
examples: The packaged foods contained detailed nutrition labels
All packaged items must pass quality inspection

definitions: completely filled with no room for more people or things
pressed or squeezed tightly together into a compact mass
examples: The packed stadium erupted when the home team scored
Every packed train during rush hour tests commuters' patience
The tightly packed snow made perfect snowballs
She kept her packed suitcase ready for emergencies

definitions: filled or covered with soft material for comfort or protection
examples: The padded chair provided comfort during long meetings
Athletes wear padded gear to prevent injuries

definitions: relating to the branch of medicine dealing with children and their diseases
examples: The paediatric ward specialized in treating young patients
She completed her paediatric residency at the children's hospital

definitions: relating to religious beliefs outside of the main world religions, often polytheistic
examples: Ancient pagan rituals celebrated the changing seasons
The pagan symbols were carved into standing stones

definitions: having received money in exchange for work or goods
having been settled or discharged as a debt or obligation
examples: All paid employees receive health insurance benefits
The paid consultant provided valuable expertise
The paid invoice was filed with accounting records
Make sure all bills are paid before month's end

definitions: showing or expressing physical or emotional pain, hurt, or distress
examples: Her pained expression revealed the bad news immediately
He gave a pained smile when asked about the divorce

definitions: not causing physical pain or discomfort when experienced or performed
examples: The dentist promised the procedure would be completely painless
Modern technology makes many medical tests virtually painless

definitions: done with or employing great care, thoroughness, and attention to detail
examples: The archaeologist's painstaking work revealed ancient artifacts
Her painstaking research took three years to complete
